conclusion: The problem involves determining the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab.

The image shows a wooden block P of mass m sliding on a long wooden board ab of mass M, which is placed on a horizontal ground and remains stationary. The block P has a velocity v, and the board ab is labeled with points a and b.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between the wooden block P and the long wooden board ab is μ2, and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the long wooden board ab and the ground is μ1.
The ground is stationary, so there is no net force acting on it.
The wooden block P is sliding on the long wooden board ab.
The frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is the frictional force between the two surfaces.
The frictional force is given by the formula F = μ1 N, where N is the normal force.
The normal force is the force perpendicular to the surface, which is the weight of the wooden block P.
The weight of the wooden block P is mg, where m is the mass of the wooden block P and g is the acceleration due to gravity.
The normal force is calculated as N = mg.
The frictional force is calculated as F = μ1 N.
Substituting the value of N from the previous step, the frictional force becomes F = μ1 mg.
The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is μ1 mg.
